title: 25-Years-Owned 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S 6-Speed
description: This 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S coupe was purchased by the current owner in 2000, who has since added 13k of the 21k miles shown. The car was specified in Black over Black leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Motor Sound Package, a power-operated sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, xenon headlights, 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, aluminum-look interior accents, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo, a Nokia Digital Sound Processing system, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 993 C4S coupe is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with manufacturer's literature, a stamped maintenance booklet, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the owner's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 25-Years-Owned 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #190,270.
text: This 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S coupe was purchased by the current owner in 2000, who has since added 13k of the 21k miles shown. The car was specified in Black over Black leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Motor Sound Package, a power-operated sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, xenon headlights, 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, aluminum-look interior accents, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo, a Nokia Digital Sound Processing system, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 993 C4S coupe is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with manufacturer’s literature, a stamped maintenance booklet, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the owner’s name. The 993 C4S features wider rear bodywork in comparison with the standard Carrera as well as a front air dam derived from the contemporary Turbo. This example is finished in Black (741) and features xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, heated power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, rear bumperettes, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. The hood has been repainted along with a bumper cover, and the paint has swirls. The 18″ Turbo Twist wheels are mounted with Bridgestone tires. The car features an Automatic Brake Differential (ABD), and the 993 was the first 911 to feature multi-link rear suspension. Braking is handled by red-finished Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners. The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Black leather with Porsche-crest headrests and painted seatbacks. The interior was specified with an aluminum–look shift knob and handbrake lever, and additional equipment includes a Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo, a Nokia Digital Sound Processing (DSP) system, cruise control, and air conditioning. Instrumentation includes aluminum-look dials with a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, a Quarz analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 21k miles, approximately 13k of which were added under current ownership. The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. The car is equipped with the optional Motor Sound Package, which added a revised intake and mufflers. Power is sent to all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle. Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information: L741 – Black paint SA – Black leather upholstery C02 – Version for USA X71 – Aluminum-look instrument dials with chromed rings X97 – Aluminum shift knob X98 – Aluminum parking brake lever 159 – Motor Sound Package 373 – Sport seat, left 374 – Sport seat, right 425 – Rear window wiper 454 – Cruise control 480 – Six-speed manual gearbox 601 – Xenon headlamps 650 – Power sunroof 680 – Nokia Digital Sound Processing 688 – Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. html:
This 1996 Porsche 911 Carrera 4S coupe was purchased by the current owner in 2000, who has since added 13k of the 21k miles shown. The car was specified in Black over Black leather and is powered by a 3.6-liter flat-six that drives all four wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Equipment includes the Motor Sound Package, a power-operated sunroof, a speed-activated rear spoiler, xenon headlights, 18″ Turbo Twist wheels, aluminum-look interior accents, power-adjustable front sport seats, a Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo, a Nokia Digital Sound Processing system, cruise control, and air conditioning. This 993 C4S coupe is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with manufacturer’s literature, a stamped maintenance booklet, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the owner’s name.

The 993 C4S features wider rear bodywork in comparison with the standard Carrera as well as a front air dam derived from the contemporary Turbo. This example is finished in Black (741) and features xenon headlights with washers, fog lights, heated power-adjustable mirrors, a power-operated sunroof, rear bumperettes, a speed-activated rear spoiler, a rear window wiper, and dual exhaust outlets. The hood has been repainted along with a bumper cover, and the paint has swirls.

The 18″ Turbo Twist wheels are mounted with Bridgestone tires. The car features an Automatic Brake Differential (ABD), and the 993 was the first 911 to feature multi-link rear suspension. Braking is handled by red-finished Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at all four corners.

The power-adjustable front sport seats are upholstered in Black leather with Porsche-crest headrests and painted seatbacks. The interior was specified with an aluminum–look shift knob and handbrake lever, and additional equipment includes a Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo, a Nokia Digital Sound Processing (DSP) system, cruise control, and air conditioning.

Instrumentation includes aluminum-look dials with a central tachometer with a 6,800-rpm redline, a 180-mph speedometer, a Quarz analog clock, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, and fuel level. The six-digit odometer shows 21k miles, approximately 13k of which were added under current ownership.

The air-cooled 3.6L flat-six features a VarioRam intake system and was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 250 lb-ft of torque. The car is equipped with the optional Motor Sound Package, which added a revised intake and mufflers.

Power is sent to all four wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle.

Decoding the option sticker reveals the following information:

  • L741 – Black paint
  • SA – Black leather upholstery
  • C02 – Version for USA
  • X71 – Aluminum-look instrument dials with chromed rings
  • X97 – Aluminum shift knob
  • X98 – Aluminum parking brake lever
  • 159 – Motor Sound Package
  • 373 – Sport seat, left
  • 374 – Sport seat, right
  • 425 – Rear window wiper
  • 454 – Cruise control
  • 480 – Six-speed manual gearbox
  • 601 – Xenon headlamps
  • 650 – Power sunroof
  • 680 – Nokia Digital Sound Processing
  • 688 – Becker-Porsche CDR-210 stereo

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage.
